main event: A round, saucer-shaped object was sighted over Beloit, Wisconsin on March 1, 1966.
interesting points: The object was the size of a 50-cent piece held at arm's length, or slightly larger.
The object had a red glow that brightened and dimmed.
The object had tiny holes around the outside that also glowed.
The object was initially stationary, then moved against the wind, gliding and diving back to its original position several times.
The observation lasted 35-40 minutes, and the object disappeared into the clouds.
sighted object: A round, saucer-shaped object with a red glow
